item.title: Commercial Advert Parked on Corner Before B&Q, 31st December
item.description:
This car with an adver for Maths and Science tuition is always parked in the evenings just before B&Q and causes congestion with it's position on the road, particularly with buses...this is blatant "advertisement" and placed on a dangerous bend of what is a busy main road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footscray Road, Eltham

item.title: Peel Plaza NW6 , Kilburn Park Medical Pharmacy NW6, 31st December
item.description:
Peel Plaza The BINS are PACKED with RUBBISH. They NEED Emptying. The Area NEEDS Sweeping. The Peel Plaza is NEW and it already looks like a DUMPSTER. People are Using the Bin as A RUBBISH TIP. One of the Bins is located along Merle Court in Peel Plaza. It’s DISGUSTING and Makes Peel Plaza Look SCRUFFY.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Neighbours dumping household rubbish, 31st December
item.description:
My neighbours, located at 50B Kingsland high street, E8 2JP. Dump all their rubbish here. It has been reported many times. It attracts rats and it smells very badly. I'll have to report again in a few days. Is there any way you can have a word with them?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stanborough Passage, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle Breakdown Caused by Poor Road Conditions on New Year’s Eve/ More than 10’ Pothole, 31st December
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally report a serious issue I experienced due to poor road conditions within the London Borough of Southwark. On New Year’s Eve, my vehicle broke down after hitting a pothole / badly maintained section of road. As a result, I was stranded for approximately five hours, during which I was forced to call two separate breakdown services in order to recover my vehicle. This incident caused significant financial loss, considerable stress, and a major disruption to my time on an already difficult date. My vehicle was insured and roadworthy prior to this incident, and there were no warning signs or barriers indicating a hazardous road condition. I believe this situation arose due to inadequate road maintenance and management, and I would like this matter to be investigated. I am seeking guidance on how to submit a formal claim for the costs incurred, including breakdown assistance and any related expenses. Please let me know what information or evidence you require from me to proceed. I look forward to your response. Yours faithfully, Sirak asmellash

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Wells Way, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
